info.title: Orders V2
info.description:
`/orders`endpoints integrate with point-of-sale, shipping, distribution, and inventory-management systems. 

## Order
The Order object contains a record of the purchase agreement between a shopper and a merchant. To learn more about creating orders, see [Orders API Guide](/api-docs/orders/orders-api-overview).

### Currency Fields

* `currency_code` - the display currency used to present prices to the shopper on the storefront.
* `currency_exchange_rate`: the exchange rate between the store's default currency and the display currency; when the order is created by means of the V2 endpoints, this value is always 1 (only in the storefront this value can be different to 1).

The following additional fields are returned on orders when Multi-Currency is enabled on the store:

* `store_default_currency_code` - the store's default currency
* `store_default_to_transactional_exchange_rate` - the exchange rate between the store's default currency and the transactional currency used in the order.

**Example:**

```json
{
  //...   
  "currency_id": 4,
  "currency_code": "EUR",
  "currency_exchange_rate": 1,
  "default_currency_id": 4,
  "default_currency_code": "EUR",
  "store_default_currency_codev: "USD",
  "store_default_to_transactional_exchange_rate": "100.0000000000"
  //...
}

```

## Order Coupons
Coupon code applied to an order.

## Order Messages
Messages associated with an order.

## Order Products
Product line items belonging to an order.

## Order Shipping Addresses
Customer shipping address belonging to an order.

## Order Statuses
Each order status represents a state in the order-fulfillment workflow.

## Order Taxes
Each tax applied to an order. This information can be useful for reporting purposes. All values are read-only.

## Order Shipments
Tracks a package consignment from an order that is shipped from the seller to the buyer.

## Order Shipping Addresses Quotes
Read Only. Get's all shipping quotes from an order.

get.description: Gets the collection of orders. (The default sort is by order id, from lowest to highest.)

200.description: Multiple Items -- An order that contains mulitple products. The store it set to display prices excluding taxes. The tax rate is 8.95%.

id.description: The ID of the order, a read-only value. Do not pass in PUT or POST.

customer_id.description: The ID of the customer placing the order; or 0 if it was a guest order.

date_created.description: The date this order was created. If not specified, will default to the current time. The date should be in RFC 2822 format, e.g.: Tue, 20 Nov 2012 00:00:00 +0000

date_modified.description: A read-only value representing the last modification of the order. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. RFC-2822

date_shipped.description: A read-only value representing the date of shipment. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. RFC-2822

status_id.description: The status ID of the order.

cart_id.description: The cart ID from which this order originated, if applicable. Correlates with the Cart API. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

status.description: The status will include one of the (string, optiona) - values defined under Order Statuses. This value is read-only. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation.

custom_status.description: Contains the same (string, optiona) - value as the Order Statuses object's `custom_label` property.

subtotal_ex_tax.description: Override value for subtotal excluding tax. If specified, the field `subtotal_inc_tax` is also required. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

subtotal_inc_tax.description: Override value for subtotal including tax. If specified, the field `subtotal_ex_tax` is also required. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

subtotal_tax.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to set or modify this value in a POST or PUT operation. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

base_shipping_cost.description: The value of the base shipping cost. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

shipping_cost_ex_tax.description: The value of shipping cost, excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

shipping_cost_inc_tax.description: The value of shipping cost, including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

shipping_cost_tax.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

shipping_cost_tax_class_id.description: Shipping-cost tax class. A read-only value. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. (NOTE: Value ignored if automatic tax is enabled on the store.)

base_handling_cost.description: The value of the base handling cost. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

handling_cost_ex_tax.description: The value of the handling cost, excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

handling_cost_inc_tax.description: The value of the handling cost, including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

handling_cost_tax.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

handling_cost_tax_class_id.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to set or modify this value in a POST or PUT operation. (NOTE: Value ignored if automatic tax is enabled on the store.)

base_wrapping_cost.description: The value of the base wrapping cost. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_ex_tax.description: The value of the wrapping cost, excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_inc_tax.description: The value of the wrapping cost, including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_tax.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_tax_class_id.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to set or modify this value in a POST or PUT operation. (NOTE: Value ignored if automatic tax is enabled on the store.)

total_ex_tax.description: Override value for the total, excluding tax. If specified, the field `total_inc_tax` is also required. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_inc_tax.description: Override value for the total, including tax. If specified, the field `total_ex_tax` is also required. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_tax.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to set or modify this value in a POST or PUT operation. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

items_total.description: The total number of items in the order.

items_shipped.description: The number of items that have been shipped.

payment_method.description: The payment method for this order. Can be one of the following: `Manual`, `Credit Card`, `cash`, `Test Payment Gateway`, etc.

payment_provider_id.description: The external Transaction ID/Payment ID within this order's payment provider (if a payment provider was used).

payment_status.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to set or modify this value in a POST or PUT operation.

refunded_amount.description: The amount refunded from this transaction. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

order_is_digital.description: Whether this is an order for digital products.

store_credit_amount.description: Represents the store credit that the shopper has redeemed on this individual order. This is a read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

gift_certificate_amount.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

ip_address.description: IP Address of the customer, if known.

geoip_country.description: The full name of the country where the customer made the purchase, based on the IP.

geoip_country_iso2.description: The country where the customer made the purchase, in ISO2 format, based on the IP.

currency_id.description: The ID of the currency being used in this transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

currency_code.description: The currency code of the currency being used in this transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

currency_exchange_rate.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

default_currency_id.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

default_currency_code.description: The currency code of the default currency for this type of transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

customer_message.description: Message that the customer entered (number, optiona) -o the `Order Comments` box during checkout.

discount_amount.description: Amount of discount for this transaction. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

coupon_discount.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

shipping_address_count.description: The number of shipping addresses associated with this transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

is_deleted.description: Indicates whether the order was deleted (archived). Set to to true, to archive an order.

is_email_opt_in.description: Indicates whether the shopper has selected an opt-in check box (on the checkout page) to receive emails. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

ebay_order_id.description: If the order was placed through eBay, the eBay order number will be included. Otherwise, the value will be `0`.

items.title: Form Fields
items.description: Read-Only. If you have required address form fields they will need to be set as optional before creating an order via API.

order_source.description: Orders submitted via the store's website will include a `www` value. Orders submitted via the API will be set to `external`. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

external_source.description: For orders submitted or modified via the API, using a PUT or POST operation, you can optionally pass in a value identifying the system used to generate the order. For example: `POS`. Otherwise, the value will be null.

url.description: URL of the shipping address for api requests
URL of the coupons for api requests

external_id.description: ID of the order in another system. For example, the Amazon Order ID if this is an Amazon order.This field can be updated in a /POST, but using a /PUT to update the order will return a 400 error. The field 'external_id' cannot be written to. Please remove it from your request before trying again. It can not be overwritten once set.

channel_id.description: Shows where the order originated. The channel_id will default to 1. Read-Only.

tax_provider_id.description:
BasicTaxProvider - Tax is set to manual. 

AvaTaxProvider - This is for when the tax provider has been set to automatic and the order was NOT created by the API. Used for Avalara. 

"" (blank) - When the tax provider is unknown. This includes legacy orders and orders previously created via API.
This can be set when creating an order using a POST.

delete.description:
Archives an order.

Any attempt to archive an order on a store with automatic tax enabled will fail, and will return `405 Method not allowed.`

get.description: Gets an array of the orders in the store organized by order status.

statuses.name: Incomplete
statuses.system_description: An incomplete order happens when a shopper reached the payment page, but did not complete the transaction.

id.description: The id of the type of order status

name.description: Name of the type of order status

system_label.description: System name of the type of order status.

custom_label.description: Custom order status label given in the Control Panel

system_description.description: System description of the order status
system_description.example: An incomplete order happens when a shopper reached the payment page, but did not complete the transaction.

count.description: Number of orders that exist with this status

sort_order.description: The sort order of the order status from the Control Panel

count.description: Total number of orders in the store

statuses.name: Incomplete
statuses.system_description: An incomplete order happens when a shopper reached the payment page, but did not complete the transaction.

statuses.name: Pending
statuses.system_description: Customer started the checkout process, but did not complete it.

statuses.name: Awaiting Payment
statuses.system_description: Customer has completed checkout process, but payment has yet to be confirmed.

statuses.name: Awaiting Fulfillment
statuses.system_description: Customer has completed the checkout process and payment has been confirmed.

statuses.name: Awaiting Shipment
statuses.system_description: Order has been pulled and packaged, and is awaiting collection from a shipping provider.

statuses.name: Awaiting Pickup
statuses.system_description: Order has been pulled, and is awaiting customer pickup from a seller-specified location.

statuses.name: Partially Shipped
statuses.system_description: Only some items in the order have been shipped, due to some products being pre-order only or other reasons.

statuses.name: Completed
statuses.system_description: Client has paid for their digital product and their file(s) are available for download.

statuses.name: Shipped
statuses.system_description: Order has been shipped, but receipt has not been confirmed; seller has used the Ship Items action.

statuses.name: Cancelled
statuses.system_description: Seller has cancelled an order, due to a stock inconsistency or other reasons.

statuses.name: Declined
statuses.system_description: Seller has marked the order as declined for lack of manual payment, or other reasons.

statuses.name: Refunded
statuses.system_description: Seller has used the Refund action.

statuses.name: Disputed
statuses.system_description: Customer has initiated a dispute resolution process for the PayPal transaction that paid for the order.

statuses.name: Manual Verification Required
statuses.system_description: Order on hold while some aspect needs to be manually confirmed.

statuses.name: Partially Refunded
statuses.system_description: Seller has partially refunded the order.

get.description: Gets a list of orders using the filter query

parameters.name: min_total
parameters.description: The minimum order total in float format. eg. 12.50

parameters.name: max_total
parameters.description: The maximum order total in float format. eg. 12.50

parameters.name: status_id
parameters.description: The staus ID of the order. You can get the status id from the `/orders` endpoints.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The cart ID of the order.

parameters.name: payment_method
parameters.description: The payment method used on the order.

parameters.name: min_date_created
parameters.description:
Minimum date the order was created in RFC-2822 or ISO-8601.

RFC-2822: `Thu, 20 Apr 2017 11:32:00 -0400`

ISO-8601: `2017-04-20T11:32:00.000-04:00`

parameters.name: max_date_created
parameters.description:
Maximum date the order was created in RFC-2822 or ISO-8601.

RFC-2822: `Thu, 20 Apr 2017 11:32:00 -0400`

ISO-8601: `2017-04-20T11:32:00.000-04:00`

parameters.name: min_date_modified
parameters.description:
Minimum date the order was modified in RFC-2822 or ISO-8601.

RFC-2822: `Thu, 20 Apr 2017 11:32:00 -0400`

ISO-8601: `2017-04-20T11:32:00.000-04:00`

parameters.name: max_date_modified
parameters.description:
Maximum date the order was modified in RFC-2822 or ISO-8601.

RFC-2822: `Thu, 20 Apr 2017 11:32:00 -0400`

ISO-8601: `2017-04-20T11:32:00.000-04:00`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to return in the response.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Direction to sort orders asc or desc. Ex. sort=date_created:desc

parameters.name: is_deleted
parameters.description: If the order was deleted or archived.

"" (blank) - When the tax provider is unknown. This includes legacy orders and orders previously created via API.
This can be set when creating an order using a POST.

*   billing_address

currency_exchange_rate.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

default_currency_id.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

default_currency_code.description: The currency code of the default currency for this type of transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

customer_message.description: Message that the customer entered (number, optiona) -o the `Order Comments` box during checkout.

discount_amount.description: Amount of discount for this transaction. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

coupon_discount.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

shipping_address_count.description: The number of shipping addresses associated with this transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

is_deleted.description: Indicates whether the order was deleted (archived). Set to to true, to archive an order.

is_email_opt_in.description: Indicates whether the shopper has selected an opt-in check box (on the checkout page) to receive emails. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

ebay_order_id.description: If the order was placed through eBay, the eBay order number will be included. Otherwise, the value will be `0`.

items.title: Form Fields
items.description: Read-Only. If you have required address form fields they will need to be set as optional before creating an order via API.

order_source.description: Orders submitted via the store's website will include a `www` value. Orders submitted via the API will be set to `external`. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

external_source.description: For orders submitted or modified via the API, using a PUT or POST operation, you can optionally pass in a value identifying the system used to generate the order. For example: `POS`. Otherwise, the value will be null.

url.description: URL of the shipping address for api requests
URL of the coupons for api requests

external_id.description: ID of the order in another system. For example, the Amazon Order ID if this is an Amazon order.This field can be updated in a /POST, but using a /PUT to update the order will return a 400 error. The field 'external_id' cannot be written to. Please remove it from your request before trying again. It can not be overwritten once set.

channel_id.description: Shows where the order originated. The channel_id will default to 1. Read-Only.

tax_provider_id.description:
BasicTaxProvider - Tax is set to manual. 

AvaTaxProvider - This is for when the tax provider has been set to automatic and the order was NOT created by the API. Used for Avalara. 

"" (blank) - When the tax provider is unknown. This includes legacy orders and orders previously created via API.
This can be set when creating an order using a POST.

Lists all order coupons. Optional parameters can be passed in.

|Type `int`|Type Name|
|-|-|
|`0`|`per_item_discount`|
|`1`|`percentage_discount`|
|`2`|`per_total_discount`|
|`3`|`shipping_discount`|
|`4`|`free_shipping`|
|`5`|`promotion`|

items.title: Order Coupons
items.description:
|Type `int`|Name|
|-|-|
|`0`|`per_item_discount`|
|`1`|`percentage_discount`|
|`2`|`per_total_discount`|
|`3`|`shipping_discount`|
|`4`|`free_shipping`|
|`5`|`promotion`|

id.description: Numeric ID of the coupon code.

coupon_id.description: Numeric ID of the associated coupon.

order_id.description: Numeric ID of the associated order.

amount.description:
Amount of the discount. This information is returned as in integer. Dollar and percentage discounts will return the same. 
For example, $3 returns as '3' while 5% will return as 5. Check the discount type to see what type of discount is available. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

type.title: Order Coupon Discount Type
type.description:
type 0: per_item_discount
type 1: percentage_discount
type 2: per_total_discount
type 3: shipping_discount
type 4: free_shipping
type 5: promotions

discount.description:
The amount off the order the discount is worth. For example, if an order subtotal is $90 and the discount is $3 then it will return as 3.000. If the discount is
3% then will return as 2.7000 or the amount of the order.  (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

get.description: Lists all order products on an order using `order_id`. By default, items sort from lowest to highest according to a newly created ID, separate from the `order_id` and the `product_id`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to return in the response.

base_price.description: The product's base price. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_ex_tax.description: The products price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_inc_tax.description: The products price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_tax.description:
Amount of tax applied to a single product. 

Price tax is calculated as:
`price_tax = price_inc_tax - price_ex_tax`

(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_ex_tax.description: Total base price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_inc_tax.description: Total base price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_tax.description:
Total tax applied to products.
For example, if quantity if 2, base price is 5 and tax rate is 10%. price_tax will be $.50 and total_tax will be $1.00.

If there is a manual discount applied total_tax is calcuted as the following:
`(price_ex_tax - discount)*tax_rate=total_tax`.

See [applied discounts](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/orders/orders-api/models/orderproductsapplieddiscounts) for more on how manual discounts are applied to orders. 
 
(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

get.description:
Returns a Collection of All Order Statuses.

**Order Status Descriptions:**
|Status ID | Name  | Description |
|--|--|--|
| 0 | Incomplete  | An incomplete order happens when a shopper reached the payment page, but did not complete the transaction. |
| 1 | Pending |Customer started the checkout process, but did not complete it. |
| 2 | Shipped | Order has been shipped, but receipt has not been confirmed; seller has used the Ship Items action. |
| 3 | Partially Shipped | Only some items in the order have been shipped, due to some products being pre-order only or other reasons. |
| 4 | Refunded | Seller has used the Refund action. |
| 5 | Cancelled | Seller has cancelled an order, due to a stock inconsistency or other reasons. |
| 6 |Declined | Seller has marked the order as declined for lack of manual payment, or other reasons. |
| 7 | Awaiting Payment | Customer has completed checkout process, but payment has yet to be confirmed. |
| 8 | Awaiting Pickup | Order has been pulled, and is awaiting customer pickup from a seller-specified location. |
| 9 | Awaiting Shipment | Order has been pulled and packaged, and is awaiting collection from a shipping provider. |
| 10 | Completed | Client has paid for their digital product and their file(s) are available for download. |
| 11 | Awaiting Fulfillment | Customer has completed the checkout process and payment has been confirmed. |
| 12 | Manual Verification Required | Order on hold while some aspect needs to be manually confirmed. |
| 13 | Disputed | Customer has initiated a dispute resolution process for the PayPal transaction that paid for the order. |
| 14 | Partially Refunded | Seller has partially refunded the order. |

system_description.example: An incomplete order happens when a shopper reached the payment page, but did not complete the transaction.

count.description: Number of orders that exist with this status

sort_order.description: The sort order of the order status from the Control Panel

Gets all order taxes using `order_id`.
Each tax applied to an order. This information can be useful for reporting purposes.

`order_product_id` and `line_item_type` are also returned

post.description:
Creates an *Order Shipment*. To learn how to create an Order Shipment, see [Orders Overview](/api-docs/orders/orders-api-overview#orders-api-overview_create-order-shipment). 

**Required Fields**
*   order_address_id 
*   items
*   shipping_provider  

**Notes**  
`tracking_carrier` is optional, but if you include it, its value must refer/map to the same carrier service as the `shipping_provider` value. Acceptable values for `tracking_carrier` are an empty string (`""`), or one of the valid tracking-carrier values viewable [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1w9c_aECSCGyf-oOrvGeUniDl-ARGKemfZl0qSsav8D4/pubhtml?gid=0&single=true) and downloadable as a .CSV file [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mTueEynfcEmwsU2y2Jd2MX-8GKwNZrmlRMBcIElg9aY/pub?gid=0&single=true&output=csv).

type.description: Type of product

base_price.description: The product's base price. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_ex_tax.description: The products price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_inc_tax.description: The products price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_tax.description:
Amount of tax applied to a single product. 

Price tax is calculated as:
`price_tax = price_inc_tax - price_ex_tax`

(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_ex_tax.description: Total base price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_inc_tax.description: Total base price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_tax.description:
Total tax applied to products.
For example, if quantity if 2, base price is 5 and tax rate is 10%. price_tax will be $.50 and total_tax will be $1.00.

If there is a manual discount applied total_tax is calcuted as the following:
`(price_ex_tax - discount)*tax_rate=total_tax`.

See [applied discounts](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/orders/orders-api/models/orderproductsapplieddiscounts) for more on how manual discounts are applied to orders. 
 
(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

base_cost_price.description: The product's cost price.  This can be set using the Catalog API. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer) Read Only

cost_price_inc_tax.description:
The product's cost price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)
The cost of your products to you; this is never shown to customers, but can be used for accounting purposes. Read Only

cost_price_ex_tax.description:
The products cost price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)
The cost of your products to you; this is never shown to customers, but can be used for accounting purposes. Read Only

weight.description: Weight of the product. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_inc_tax.description: The value of the wrapping cost, including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_tax.description: Tax applied to gift-wrapping option. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

items.title: Order Products Applied Discounts
items.description:
When applying a manual discount to an order (not a product level discount), the discount is distributed across products in proportion to the products price. 
`(total_manual_discount*price_ex_tax)/subtotal_ex_tax`

id.description: Name of the coupon applied to order

amount.description: Amount of the discount.(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

name.description:
Name of the coupon. 
`Manual Discount` when creating a manual discount.

code.description:
Coupon Code. 
There is no code when creating a manual discount.

target.description: Determines if the discount if discount was applied at the Order or Product level. Read Only.

display_name.description: The name of the option, as shown on the storefront.

display_value.description: The name of the value, as shown on the storefront.

value.description: This value is used to access the Customer File Upload

type.description: Option Type

name.description: The options name, as used internally. Must be unique

display_style.description: How it is displayed on the storefront. Examples include Drop-down, radio buttons, or rectangles.

external_id.description: ID of the order in another system. For example, the Amazon Order ID if this is an Amazon order.This field can be updated in a /POST, but using a /PUT to update the order will return a 400 error. The field 'external_id' cannot be written to. Please remove it from your request before trying again. It can not be overwritten once set.

upc.description: Universal Product Code. Can be written to for custom products and catalog products.

variant_id.description: Products `variant_id`. PUT or POST. This field is not available for custom products.

url.description:
This URL will return a 204 for shipping quotes. To return shipping quotes:
`/shipping_addresses/shipping_address_id/shipping_quotes`

resource.description:
This URL will return a 204 for shipping quotes. To return shipping quotes:
`/shipping_addresses/shipping_address_id/shipping_quotes`

get.description:
Gets a shipping address associated with an order.

Returned in the response is shipping_quotes object. Please use the Get Shipping Quotes Endpoint. Using the response will return a 204 for the shipping quote.

200.description: This response can vary depending on the shipping provider.

id.description: Id of the shipping quote

timestamp.description: Time the order was created in RFC 2822 format.

shipping_provider_quote.description: This can vary based on the shipping provider. Manual shipping methods such as fixed will return an empty array. Shipping providers such as UPS will return an object with the shipping information. Since the shipping quote is tied to a shipping address only one quote will return in the response.

rate_code.description: Type of delivery. This can vary based on shipping quote.

rate_id.description: This can vary based on shipping quote

get.description:
Gets any shipping quotes assocated to an order. 

This is a read only enpoint and the output can vary based on the shipping quote. A shipping quote can only be generated using the storefront at this time. Orders that are created in the control panel or via api return a 204 for this endpoint since a shipping quote is not generated during that process.

id.description: The ID of the order, a read-only value. Do not pass in PUT or POST.

customer_id.description: The ID of the customer placing the order; or 0 if it was a guest order.

date_created.description: The date this order was created. If not specified, will default to the current time. The date should be in RFC 2822 format, e.g.: Tue, 20 Nov 2012 00:00:00 +0000

date_modified.description: A read-only value representing the last modification of the order. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. RFC-2822

date_shipped.description: A read-only value representing the date of shipment. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. RFC-2822

status_id.description: The status ID of the order.

cart_id.description: The cart ID from which this order originated, if applicable. Correlates with the Cart API. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

status.description: The status will include one of the (string, optiona) - values defined under Order Statuses. This value is read-only. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation.

custom_status.description: Contains the same (string, optiona) - value as the Order Statuses object's `custom_label` property.

base_shipping_cost.description: The value of the base shipping cost. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

shipping_cost_tax.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_ex_tax.description: The value of the wrapping cost, excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_inc_tax.description: The value of the wrapping cost, including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_tax.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to modify or set this value in a POST or PUT operation. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_tax_class_id.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to set or modify this value in a POST or PUT operation. (NOTE: Value ignored if automatic tax is enabled on the store.)

total_inc_tax.description: Override value for the total, including tax. If specified, the field `total_ex_tax` is also required. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_tax.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to set or modify this value in a POST or PUT operation. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

items_total.description: The total number of items in the order.

items_shipped.description: The number of items that have been shipped.

payment_method.description: The payment method for this order. Can be one of the following: `Manual`, `Credit Card`, `cash`, `Test Payment Gateway`, etc.

payment_provider_id.description: The external Transaction ID/Payment ID within this order's payment provider (if a payment provider was used).

payment_status.description: A read-only value. Do not attempt to set or modify this value in a POST or PUT operation.

refunded_amount.description: The amount refunded from this transaction. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

order_is_digital.description: Whether this is an order for digital products.

geoip_country_iso2.description: The country where the customer made the purchase, in ISO2 format, based on the IP.

currency_id.description: The ID of the currency being used in this transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

currency_code.description: The currency code of the currency being used in this transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

currency_exchange_rate.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

default_currency_id.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

default_currency_code.description: The currency code of the default currency for this type of transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

customer_message.description: Message that the customer entered (number, optiona) -o the `Order Comments` box during checkout.

discount_amount.description: Amount of discount for this transaction. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

coupon_discount.description: A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

shipping_address_count.description: The number of shipping addresses associated with this transaction. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

is_deleted.description: Indicates whether the order was deleted (archived). Set to to true, to archive an order.

is_email_opt_in.description: Indicates whether the shopper has selected an opt-in check box (on the checkout page) to receive emails. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

ebay_order_id.description: If the order was placed through eBay, the eBay order number will be included. Otherwise, the value will be `0`.

items.title: Form Fields
items.description: Read-Only. If you have required address form fields they will need to be set as optional before creating an order via API.

order_source.description: Orders submitted via the store's website will include a `www` value. Orders submitted via the API will be set to `external`. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

external_source.description: For orders submitted or modified via the API, using a PUT or POST operation, you can optionally pass in a value identifying the system used to generate the order. For example: `POS`. Otherwise, the value will be null.

URL of the coupons for api requests

For example, the Amazon Order ID if this is an Amazon order.This field can be updated in a /POST, but using a /PUT to update the order will return a 400 error. The field 'external_id' cannot be written to. Please remove it from your request before trying again. It can not be overwritten once set.

channel_id.description: Shows where the order originated. The channel_id will default to 1. Read-Only.

tax_provider_id.description:
BasicTaxProvider - Tax is set to manual. 

AvaTaxProvider - This is for when the tax provider has been set to automatic and the order was NOT created by the API. Used for Avalara. 

"" (blank) - When the tax provider is unknown. This includes legacy orders and orders previously created via API.
This can be set when creating an order using a POST.

price_tax.description:
Amount of tax applied to a single product. 

Price tax is calculated as:
`price_tax = price_inc_tax - price_ex_tax`

(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_ex_tax.description: Total base price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_inc_tax.description: Total base price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_tax.description:
Total tax applied to products.
For example, if quantity if 2, base price is 5 and tax rate is 10%. price_tax will be $.50 and total_tax will be $1.00.

If there is a manual discount applied total_tax is calcuted as the following:
`(price_ex_tax - discount)*tax_rate=total_tax`.

See [applied discounts](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/orders/orders-api/models/orderproductsapplieddiscounts) for more on how manual discounts are applied to orders. 
 
(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

X-Auth-Client.name: X-Auth-Client
X-Auth-Client.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Orders | modify | `store_v2_orders` |
|  Orders | read-only | `store_v2_orders_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

X-Auth-Token.description:

|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Orders | modify | `store_v2_orders` |
|  Orders | read-only | `store_v2_orders_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

application/json.system_description: An incomplete order happens when a shopper reached the payment page, but did not complete the transaction.

application/json.name: Pending
application/json.system_description: Customer started the checkout process, but did not complete it.

application/json.name: Shipped
application/json.system_description: Order has been shipped, but receipt has not been confirmed; seller has used the Ship Items action.

application/json.name: Partially Shipped
application/json.system_description: Only some items in the order have been shipped, due to some products being pre-order only or other reasons.

application/json.name: Refunded
application/json.system_description: Seller has used the Refund action.

application/json.name: Cancelled
application/json.system_description: Seller has cancelled an order, due to a stock inconsistency or other reasons.

application/json.name: Declined
application/json.system_description: Seller has marked the order as declined for lack of manual payment, or other reasons.

application/json.name: Awaiting Payment
application/json.system_description: Customer has completed checkout process, but payment has yet to be confirmed.

application/json.name: Awaiting Pickup
application/json.system_description: Order has been pulled, and is awaiting customer pickup from a seller-specified location.

application/json.name: Awaiting Shipment
application/json.system_description: Order has been pulled and packaged, and is awaiting collection from a shipping provider.

application/json.name: Completed
application/json.system_description: Client has paid for their digital product and their file(s) are available for download.

application/json.name: Awaiting Fulfillment
application/json.system_description: Customer has completed the checkout process and payment has been confirmed.

application/json.name: Manual Verification Required
application/json.system_description: Order on hold while some aspect needs to be manually confirmed.

application/json.name: Disputed
application/json.system_description: Customer has initiated a dispute resolution process for the PayPal transaction that paid for the order.

application/json.name: Partially Refunded
application/json.system_description: Seller has partially refunded the order.

items.description: Read-Only. If you have required address form fields they will need to be set as optional before creating an order via API.

order_source.description: Orders submitted via the store's website will include a `www` value. Orders submitted via the API will be set to `external`. A read-only value. Do not pass in a POST or PUT.

external_source.description: For orders submitted or modified via the API, using a PUT or POST operation, you can optionally pass in a value identifying the system used to generate the order. For example: `POS`. Otherwise, the value will be null.

For example, the Amazon Order ID if this is an Amazon order.This field can be updated in a /POST, but using a /PUT to update the order will return a 400 error. The field 'external_id' cannot be written to. Please remove it from your request before trying again. It can not be overwritten once set.

channel_id.description: Shows where the order originated. The channel_id will default to 1. Read-Only.

tax_provider_id.description:
BasicTaxProvider - Tax is set to manual. 

AvaTaxProvider - This is for when the tax provider has been set to automatic and the order was NOT created by the API. Used for Avalara. 

"" (blank) - When the tax provider is unknown. This includes legacy orders and orders previously created via API.
This can be set when creating an order using a POST.

statuses.name: Incomplete
statuses.system_description: An incomplete order happens when a shopper reached the payment page, but did not complete the transaction.

statuses.name: Pending
statuses.system_description: Customer started the checkout process, but did not complete it.

statuses.name: Awaiting Payment
statuses.system_description: Customer has completed checkout process, but payment has yet to be confirmed.

statuses.name: Awaiting Fulfillment
statuses.system_description: Customer has completed the checkout process and payment has been confirmed.

statuses.name: Awaiting Shipment
statuses.system_description: Order has been pulled and packaged, and is awaiting collection from a shipping provider.

statuses.name: Awaiting Pickup
statuses.system_description: Order has been pulled, and is awaiting customer pickup from a seller-specified location.

statuses.name: Partially Shipped
statuses.system_description: Only some items in the order have been shipped, due to some products being pre-order only or other reasons.

statuses.name: Completed
statuses.system_description: Client has paid for their digital product and their file(s) are available for download.

statuses.name: Shipped
statuses.system_description: Order has been shipped, but receipt has not been confirmed; seller has used the Ship Items action.

statuses.name: Cancelled
statuses.system_description: Seller has cancelled an order, due to a stock inconsistency or other reasons.

statuses.name: Declined
statuses.system_description: Seller has marked the order as declined for lack of manual payment, or other reasons.

statuses.name: Refunded
statuses.system_description: Seller has used the Refund action.

statuses.name: Disputed
statuses.system_description: Customer has initiated a dispute resolution process for the PayPal transaction that paid for the order.

statuses.name: Manual Verification Required
statuses.system_description: Order on hold while some aspect needs to be manually confirmed.

statuses.name: Partially Refunded
statuses.system_description: Seller has partially refunded the order.

items.title: Order Coupons
items.description:
|Type `int`|Name|
|-|-|
|`0`|`per_item_discount`|
|`1`|`percentage_discount`|
|`2`|`per_total_discount`|
|`3`|`shipping_discount`|
|`4`|`free_shipping`|
|`5`|`promotion`|

id.description: Numeric ID of the coupon code.

coupon_id.description: Numeric ID of the associated coupon.

order_id.description: Numeric ID of the associated order.

amount.description:
Amount of the discount. This information is returned as in integer. Dollar and percentage discounts will return the same. 
For example, $3 returns as '3' while 5% will return as 5. Check the discount type to see what type of discount is available. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

type.title: Order Coupon Discount Type
type.description:
type 0: per_item_discount
type 1: percentage_discount
type 2: per_total_discount
type 3: shipping_discount
type 4: free_shipping
type 5: promotions

discount.description:
The amount off the order the discount is worth. For example, if an order subtotal is $90 and the discount is $3 then it will return as 3.000. If the discount is
3% then will return as 2.7000 or the amount of the order.  (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

id.description: Numeric ID of this product within this order.

order_id.description: Numeric ID of the associated order.

order_address_id.description: Numeric ID of the associated order address.

name.example: Fog Linen Chambray Towel - Beige Stripe

type.description: Type of product

base_price.description: The product's base price. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_ex_tax.description: The products price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_inc_tax.description: The products price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

price_tax.description:
Amount of tax applied to a single product. 

Price tax is calculated as:
`price_tax = price_inc_tax - price_ex_tax`

(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_ex_tax.description: Total base price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_inc_tax.description: Total base price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_tax.description:
Total tax applied to products.
For example, if quantity if 2, base price is 5 and tax rate is 10%. price_tax will be $.50 and total_tax will be $1.00.

If there is a manual discount applied total_tax is calcuted as the following:
`(price_ex_tax - discount)*tax_rate=total_tax`.

See [applied discounts](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/orders/orders-api/models/orderproductsapplieddiscounts) for more on how manual discounts are applied to orders. 
 
(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

base_cost_price.description: The product's cost price.  This can be set using the Catalog API. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer) Read Only

cost_price_inc_tax.description:
The product's cost price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)
The cost of your products to you; this is never shown to customers, but can be used for accounting purposes. Read Only

cost_price_ex_tax.description:
The products cost price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)
The cost of your products to you; this is never shown to customers, but can be used for accounting purposes. Read Only

weight.description: Weight of the product. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

cost_price_tax.description:
Tax applied to the products cost price. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)
The cost of your products to you; this is never shown to customers, but can be used for accounting purposes. Read Only

is_refunded.description: Whether the product has been refunded.

refunded_amount.description: The amount refunded from this transaction. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

base_wrapping_cost.description: The value of the base wrapping cost. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_ex_tax.description: The value of the wrapping cost, excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_inc_tax.description: The value of the wrapping cost, including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

wrapping_cost_tax.description: Tax applied to gift-wrapping option. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

event_date.description: Date of the promotional event/scheduled delivery.

fixed_shipping_cost.description: Fixed shipping cost for this product. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

ebay_item_id.description: Item ID for this product on eBay.

ebay_transaction_id.description: Transaction ID for this product on eBay.

option_set_id.description: Numeric ID of the option set applied to the product.

price_tax.description:
Amount of tax applied to a single product. 

Price tax is calculated as:
`price_tax = price_inc_tax - price_ex_tax`

(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_ex_tax.description: Total base price excluding tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_inc_tax.description: Total base price including tax. (Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

total_tax.description:
Total tax applied to products.
For example, if quantity if 2, base price is 5 and tax rate is 10%. price_tax will be $.50 and total_tax will be $1.00.

If there is a manual discount applied total_tax is calcuted as the following:
`(price_ex_tax - discount)*tax_rate=total_tax`.

See [applied discounts](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/orders/orders-api/models/orderproductsapplieddiscounts) for more on how manual discounts are applied to orders. 
 
(Float, Float-As-String, Integer)

info.title: Orders V3
info.description:
- [OAuth Scopes](#oauth-scopes)
- [Authentication](#authentication)
- [Available Endpoints](#available-endpoints)
- [Order Transactions](#order-transactions)
- [Resources](#resources)

The V3 REST API's Orders resource surfaces endpoints related to payment processing. The `/orders/{id}/transactions` endpoint returns transaction details for the specified order. 

To programmatically create, update, and delete orders themselves, see [Orders v2](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/orders). To process payments, see [Payment Processing](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/payments/payments-process-payments).

## OAuth Scopes
| UI Name                                      | Permission | Parameter                                     |
|----------------------------------------------|------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| Order Transactions                           | modify     | `store_v2_transactions`                       |
| Order Transactions                           | read-only  | `store_v2_transactions_read_only`             |
| Orders                                       | modify     | `store_v2_orders`                             |
| Orders                                       | read-only  | `store_v2_orders_read_only`                   |

For more information on OAuth Scopes, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Authentication

Requests can be authenticated by sending a `client_id` and `access_token` via `X-Auth-Client` and `X-Auth-Token` HTTP headers:

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Accept: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Available Endpoints
| Endpoint                                | Description                                                             |
|-----------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `/orders/{id}/transactions`             | Get list of transaction data for an order                               |

## Order Transactions

The `/orders/{id}/transactions` endpoint returns details about the payment instruments used to pay for an order. Depending on the payment method used, different details will be available. Not all credit card payment gateways will return full card details or all CVV/fraud response details. This is primarily used to get detailed gateway response information for credit card transactions, however it will also return any available information about digital wallet payments, as well as details about orders paid (partially or in full) via a gift certificate or store credit.

The test payment gateway available in the BigCommerce control panel does not return any payment information.

## Resources 
* [Orders Overview](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/orders/orders-overview)
* [Orders V2](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/orders)
* [Payment Processing](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/payments/payments-process-payments)

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The ID of the `Order` to which the transactions belong.

get.description:
Returns an **order's** transactions. 

**Usage Notes**
* Depending on the payment method, different information will be available (not all payment gateways return full card details or fraud detail).
* The test payment gateway does not return any information.

schema.description: Response payload for the BigCommerce Order Transactions API.

items.description: A BigCommerce Transaction object describes a single transaction.

event.description: Store event that created the transaction.

method.description: The payment method: `credit_card` - a credit-card transaction; `electronic_wallet` - an online wallet; `store_credit` - a transaction using store credit; `gift_certificate` - a transaction using a gift certificate; `custom` - manual payment methods; `token` - payment token; `nonce` - temporary payment token; `offsite` - online payment off the site (e.g., PayPal); `offline` - payment method that takes place offline.

amount.description: Amount of money in the transaction.

gateway_transaction_id.description: The transaction ID returned by the payment gateway for this transaction item.

test.description: True if the transaction performed was a test, or if the gateway is in test mode.

fraud_review.description: Result of gateway fraud review, if any. Default is `false`.

reference_transaction_id.description: Identifier for an existing transaction upon which this transaction acts.

offline.description: Offline payment (e.g., check or purchase order).

display_name.description: Display name for the offline payment.

offline.title: Offline

payment_method.description: Text entered for the payment method in the control panel.

id.description: Unique identifier for the transaction.

order_id.description: Identifier for the BigCommerce Order with which this transaction is associated.

payment_instrument_token.description: This field contains internal BigPay token for stored card that is then mapped to the actual third-party token. We currently do not offer a way to get third party tokens.These tokens are read-only and do not return any information about the payment.

avs_result.description: Address Verification Service (AVS) result from the payment gateway.

street_match.description: AVS Code for street matching result.

postal_match.description: AVS Code for postal matching result.

avs_result.title: AVS Results

cvv_result.description: Card Verification Value result from the payment gateway.
cvv_result.title: CVV Result

card_type.description: The credit-card type: Visa, MasterCard, etc.

card_iin.description: The IIN of a credit-card number.

card_last4.description: The last 4 digits of a credit-card number.

card_expiry_month.description: The expiry month of a credit-card.

card_expiry_year.description: The expiry year of a credit-card.

original_balance.description: The balance on a gift certificate when it was purchased.

starting_balance.description: The balance on a gift certificate at the time of this purchase.

remaining_balance.description: The remaining balance on a gift certificate.

status.description: The status of a gift certificate: `active` - gift certificate is active; `pending` - gift certificate purchase is pending; `disabled` - gift certificate is disabled; `expired` - gift certificate is expired.

remaining_balance.description: Remaining balance of shopper's store credit.

X-Auth-Client.name: X-Auth-Client
X-Auth-Client.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Order Transactions | modify | `store_v2_transactions` |
|  Order Transactions | read-only | `store_v2_transactions_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

info.title: Storefront Orders
info.description:
## Storefront Orders API
Returns order data immediately after an order is placed on the storefront.

get.description: Returns *Order* data. This will return order data immediately after an order is placed on the storefront.

data.title: Data
data.description: Response data container for Order endpoints (`POST /order` and `POST /order/{orderId}`).

cartId.description: The Id of cart that was converted to order.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: This will always be the same between cart and checkout.

decimalPlaces.description: Number of decimal places for the currency. For example, USD currency has two decimal places.

baseAmount.description: Cost of cart's contents, before applying discounts.

orderAmount.description: Sum of line-items amounts, minus cart-level discounts and coupons. This amount includes taxes (where applicable).

orderAmountAsInteger.description: Order amount represented in integer. Eg. 1234 for $12.34

coupons.description: Array of `AppliedCoupon` objects applied to this cart.

id.description: The coupon ID.

displayName.description: The coupon title based on different types provided in control panel section

couponType.description: Key name to identify the type of coupon.

discountedAmount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.

discounts.description: Array of `AppliedDiscount` objects applied to this cart.

name.description: The name provided by the merchant.

discountedAmount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.

id.description: The line-item ID.

parentId.description: Bundled items will have their parent's item Id.

url.description: The product URL.

imageUrl.description: URL of an image of this item, accessible on the internet.

discounts.description: List of discounts applied to this item, as an array of AppliedDiscount objects.

name.description: The name provided by the merchant.

discountedAmount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.

discountAmount.description: The total value of all discounts applied to this item (excluding coupon).

couponAmount.description: The total value of all coupons applied to this item.

listPrice.description: Item's list price, as quoted by the manufacturer/distributor.

salePrice.description: Item's price after all discounts are applied. (The final price before tax calculation.)

extendedListPrice.description: Item's list price multiplied by the quantity.

extendedSalePrice.description: Item's sale price multiplied by the quantity.

type.description: the product type - physical or digital

addedByPromotion.description: Whether this item has been added automatically by a promotion.

isShippingRequired.description: Whether this item requires shipping to a physical address.

id.description: The line-item ID.

parentId.description: Bundled items will have their parent's item Id.

url.description: The product URL.

imageUrl.description: URL of an image of this item, accessible on the internet.

discounts.description: List of discounts applied to this item, as an array of AppliedDiscount objects.

name.description: The name provided by the merchant.

discountedAmount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.

discountAmount.description: The total value of all discounts applied to this item (excluding coupon).

couponAmount.description: The total value of all coupons applied to this item.

extendedListPrice.description: Item's list price multiplied by the quantity.

extendedSalePrice.description: Item's sale price multiplied by the quantity.

type.description: the product type - physical or digital

downloadFileUrls.description: URLs to download all product files.

downloadPageUrl.description: The URL for the combined downloads page.

downloadSize.description: Combined download size, in human-readable style. E.g.: `30MB`.

amount.description: Price of the item

type.description: Explicitly specifying the gift certificate type

fieldValue.description: This can also be an array for fields that need to support list of values (e.g., a set of check boxes.)

customerCreated.description: For guest checkouts, this flag will identify whether a new customer account was created for this order, or whether the billing email already existed on the store.

hasDigitalItems.description: Specifies whether this order has at least one digital item.

isDownloadable.description: Specifies whether this order is fully paid, so that digital items can be downloaded.

isComplete.description: Specifies whether this order is complete and ready to be taken to the order confirmation page.

customerMessage.description: Shopper's provided message for the order

listPrice.description: Item's list price, as quoted by the manufacturer/distributor.

salePrice.description: Item's price after all discounts are applied. (The final price before tax calculation.)

type.description: the product type - physical or digital

downloadFileUrls.description: URLs to download all product files.

downloadPageUrl.description: The URL for the combined downloads page.

downloadSize.description: Combined download size, in human-readable style. E.g.: `30MB`.

amount.description: Price of the item

type.description: Explicitly specifying the gift certificate type

fieldValue.description: This can also be an array for fields that need to support list of values (e.g., a set of check boxes.)

customerCreated.description: For guest checkouts, this flag will identify whether a new customer account was created for this order, or whether the billing email already existed on the store.

hasDigitalItems.description: Specifies whether this order has at least one digital item.

isDownloadable.description: Specifies whether this order is fully paid, so that digital items can be downloaded.

isComplete.description: Specifies whether this order is complete and ready to be taken to the order confirmation page.

customerMessage.description: Shopper's provided message for the order
